comment:
* A parcelable representing a nearby device that can be used for media transfer. *

* This class includes: *

    *
  • an ID identifying the media route.
    • *
  • a range zone specifying how far away this device is from the device with the media route. *
    • *
* * @hide

variables.name: RANGE_FAR
variables.comment: * Distance is very far away from the peer device.

variables.name: RANGE_LONG
variables.comment: * Distance is relatively long from the peer device, typically a few meters.

variables.name: RANGE_CLOSE
variables.comment: * Distance is close to the peer device, typically with one or two meter.

variables.name: RANGE_WITHIN_REACH
variables.comment: * Distance is very close to the peer device, typically within one meter or less.

variables.name: RANGE_WEIGHT_LIST
variables.comment: * A list stores all the range and list from far to close, used for range comparison.

methods.name: public static String rangeZoneToString(@RangeZone int rangeZone)
methods.comment:
* Gets a human-readable string of the range zone.
     *
     * @hide

methods.name: public static int compareRangeZones(@RangeZone int rangeZone, @RangeZone int anotherRangeZone)
methods.comment:
* Compares two ranges and return result.
     *
     * @return 0 means two ranges are the same, -1 means first range is closer, 1 means farther
     *
     * @hide

methods.name: public void writeToParcel(@NonNull Parcel dest, int flags)
public String getMediaRoute2Id()
methods.comment:
* Returns the ID of the media route associated with the device.
     *
     * @see MediaRoute2Info#getId

methods.name: public int getRangeZone()
methods.comment: Returns the range that the device is currently in.

methodNames: public static String rangeZoneToString(@RangeZone int rangeZone)
public static int compareRangeZones(@RangeZone int rangeZone, @RangeZone int anotherRangeZone)
public void writeToParcel(@NonNull Parcel dest, int flags)
